meanings.definition: The rail around the stern of a ship.
meanings.sent1: The taffrails on the ship were painted white for visibility.
meanings.sent2: Sailors often lean against the taffrails to enjoy the sea breeze.
meanings.sent3: The seagull perched on the taffrails, pretending to be the captain.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the taffrails cast long shadows on the deck.
meanings.sent5: The taffrails creaked softly as the ship sailed through the night.

meanings.definition: The upper part of a ship's stern.
meanings.sent1: The captain stood proudly on the taffrails, surveying the ocean.
meanings.sent2: The taffrails provided a perfect spot for stargazing at night.
meanings.sent3: A mischievous sailor tied a flag to the taffrails as a prank.
meanings.sent4: The moonlight reflected off the polished taffrails, creating a magical glow.
meanings.sent5: The taffrails offered a stunning view of the horizon at sunrise.
